page.title: 03Churches & Chapels,Liskeard
page.content: Churches play a central role in the community life of Liskeard and the nearby villages and small towns.All local denominations took part in the BBC's 'Songs of Praise'(to be shown 1986).There are 3 predominate places of worship,with extensive parishes. {St.Martin's(CoE)}is the 3rd largest church in Cornwall and dates from Norman times.The main{Wesley Chapel} was opened in July 1846 and can seat over 900 but now has a community roll of 540.(Wesley visited the Liskeard area several times).The Catholic church,{Our Lady and St. Neot},was built in 1863 of local granite and slate with seating for 150.It has fine statues of St.Neot. In addition to the many churches and chapels of the immediate district are places of worship for{Jehovah {Witnesses}and the{Salvation Army.
